snippet: Mr. Bush said today’s Republican Party is out of step with the legacy of his father and Ronald Reagan.
abstract: Former Governor Jeb Bush of Florida, during breakfast with national reporters in Manhattan, criticizes the Republican Party for its approach to a number of issues; comments offer glimpse into a growing distance between the Bush family, who once embodied mainstream Republicanism, and current GOP leaders.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush said today’s Republican Party is out of step with the legacy of his father and Ronald Reagan.

headline.seo: Jeb Bush Takes Aim at Fellow Republicans
headline.main: Jeb Bush Questions G.O.P.’s Shift to the Right
headline.print_headline: Jeb Bush Offers Critical Views of Modern Republican Party and Its ‘Orthodoxy’
